title-part.text: MEANS OF ATTACK OR DEFENCE, e.g. CAMOUFLAGE, IN GENERAL

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

Clearing or neutralising barbed wire obstacles

reference.text: ; smallarm attachments for wire cutting F41C27/20

title-part.text: Systems specially adapted for detection of landmines
Systems specially adapted for detection of landmines
Biological systems, e.g. with detection by animals or plants
Chemical systems, e.g. with detection by vapour analysis
Magnetic, electromagnetic, acoustic or radiation systems, e.g. ground penetrating radars or metal-detectors
Mechanical systems, e.g. prodding sticks for manual detection
with ground-impacting means for activating mines by the use of mechanical impulses, e.g. flails or stamping elements
with ground-penetrating elements, e.g. with means for removing buried landmines from the soil
the elements being rotary ground-penetrating elements
using brushing or sweeping means or dozers to push mines lying on a surface aside
using means for removing mines intact from a surface
with rollers creating a surface load on the ground, e.g. steadily increasing surface load, for triggering purposes
Decoy or sacrificial devices attachable to vehicles
Means of attack or defence not otherwise provided for

reference.text: details of radar or sonar systems G01S7/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Ballistically deployed systems for restraining persons or animals, e.g. ballistically deployed nets
Electrical discharge weapons, e.g. for stunning
for nearby electrical discharge, i.e. the electrodes being positioned on the device and the device brought manually or otherwise into contact with a nearby target

reference.text: batons with electric discharge capability F41B15/04; electric shock devices for animals A01K15/02

CPC-specific-text.text: for remote electrical discharge via conducting wires, e.g. via wire-tethered electrodes shot at a target
for remote electrical discharge by means of a wireless projectile
for remote electrical discharge via liquid jets

reference.text: details of the gun for generating the liquid jets F41B9/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Directed energy weapons, i.e. devices that direct a beam of high energy content toward a target for incapacitating or destroying the target
the high-energy beam being a laser beam
for blinding or dazzling, i.e. by overstimulating the opponent's eyes or the enemy's sensor equipment
causing structural damage to the target
the high-energy beam being of microwave type, e.g. for causing a heating effect in the target
the high-energy beam being a radiofrequency beam
the high-energy beam being acoustic, e.g. sonic, infrasonic or ultrasonic
the high-energy beam being a bright light, e.g. for dazzling or blinding purposes
Devices generating an electromagnetic pulse, e.g. for disrupting or destroying electronic devices
